title: Build Sequence: PRD-001 (Part 3 of 7)
buildPhilosophy: Generated using dependency-first strategy. Each FBS represents a testable, deployable increment.

buildSequence.title: Skill Gap Analysis System
buildSequence.summary: Implements comprehensive skill gap analysis with fuzzy matching for skill synonyms, confidence scoring for matches, and skill categorization. Provides detailed breakdown of matched, missing, and extra skills with intelligent grouping and sorting capabilities.
testableOutcomes: System displays three distinct skill categories: matched skills, missing skills, and extra skills
Skills that appear in both CV and job requirements are categorized as matched skills
Skills required by job but not in CV are categorized as missing skills
Skills in CV but not required by job are categorized as extra skills
Each skill category displays count of skills in format 'Category Name (X)'
Skills within each category are sorted alphabetically for consistent presentation
System recognizes 'JS' and 'JavaScript' as matching skills using fuzzy matching
System recognizes 'Machine Learning' and 'ML' as matching skills using fuzzy matching
System recognizes 'React.js' and 'ReactJS' as matching skills using fuzzy matching
System recognizes 'Node' and 'Node.js' as matching skills using fuzzy matching
Fuzzy matched skills display both CV term and job term (e.g., 'JavaScript (JS in CV)')
System achieves at least 90% accuracy for standard technology term fuzzy matching
Exact skill matches display 100% confidence score
Fuzzy skill matches display confidence scores between 70-99% based on similarity
Matched skills are sorted by confidence score in descending order within categories
Skills with confidence below 70% are excluded from matched skills section
Each matched skill displays confidence level as percentage or visual indicator
Technical skills are grouped under 'Technical Skills' category
Soft skills are grouped under 'Soft Skills' category
Certifications are grouped under 'Certifications' category
Each skill category shows separate counts for matched, missing, and extra skills
Skills that don't fit standard categories are placed in 'Other Skills' category

deliverables: Skill gap analysis engine with three-category classification
Fuzzy matching service with synonym recognition
Skill confidence scoring algorithm
Skill categorization service with predefined categories
Skill synonym dictionary and mapping system
Skill gap analysis UI components
Confidence indicator visualization
Skill category display components
API endpoints for skill analysis
Comprehensive test suite for fuzzy matching accuracy

buildSequence.implementationNotes: Large scope due to complex fuzzy matching algorithms and skill categorization logic. Requires building comprehensive skill synonym dictionary and implementing confidence scoring. Critical for user experience as it directly impacts job application decisions.

buildSequence.title: Skill Analysis Export & History
buildSequence.summary: Implements skill gap analysis export to PDF, shareable link generation, and historical tracking. Users can export analysis reports, share them via time-limited links, and view their skill development progress over time.
testableOutcomes: User can export skill gap analysis as PDF containing all matched, missing, and extra skills with confidence scores
Exported PDF includes job title, company name, analysis date, and user's name for reference
User can generate shareable link that remains valid for exactly 30 days
Anonymous users can view shared skill gap analysis without system registration
User can view chronological list of all previous skill gap analyses
System displays skills that moved from 'missing' to 'matched' status over time
System highlights most frequently missing skills across multiple job applications
System provides skill development recommendations based on recurring gaps
Updated CV skills are reflected in subsequent analysis matching calculations

deliverables: PDF export service with skill analysis formatting
Shareable link generation and validation API
Historical analysis tracking database schema
Skill development trend analyzer
Export and history UI components
Link sharing and access control middleware

buildSequence.implementationNotes: Requires PDF generation library integration and time-limited link storage mechanism. Historical tracking needs efficient database queries for trend analysis.

buildSequence.title: AI-Powered Gap Analysis with Ollama
buildSequence.summary: Integrates local Ollama LLM service to generate comprehensive gap analysis reports with strengths, missing skills, and improvement suggestions. Provides AI-powered insights while maintaining data privacy through local processing.
testableOutcomes: System successfully calls Ollama LLM API to generate gap analysis from user profile and job posting
Generated analysis contains exactly 3-5 strength points highlighting matching qualifications
Generated analysis contains exactly 3-5 missing skills or gaps from job requirements
Generated analysis contains exactly 3-5 actionable improvement suggestions
Generated analysis includes overall assessment summary of candidate fit
System returns appropriate error message when user profile data is invalid or empty
System returns appropriate error message when job posting data is invalid or empty
System establishes successful connection to local Ollama API endpoint on startup
System handles Ollama connection failures gracefully with fallback messages
System times out after configurable duration and returns error when Ollama API is unresponsive
System confirms LLM model availability and readiness during connection validation
Strengths section displays as clearly labeled bullet-pointed items
Missing skills section displays as clearly labeled bullet-pointed items
Improvement suggestions section displays as clearly labeled actionable recommendations
Overall assessment appears as properly formatted summary paragraph
System validates LLM response contains 3-5 distinct points in each required section
System requests regeneration or provides error message when LLM response is incomplete
System handles malformed LLM responses gracefully and logs parsing errors

deliverables: Ollama LLM integration service with connection management
Gap analysis prompt engineering and template system
LLM response validation and quality checking service
Error handling and retry logic for LLM operations
Gap analysis report formatting and display components
Configuration management for Ollama endpoint and model settings

buildSequence.implementationNotes: High risk due to LLM integration complexity and response quality variability. Requires robust prompt engineering, response validation, and fallback mechanisms for LLM failures.

buildSequence.title: Cover Letter Generation System
buildSequence.summary: Implements AI-powered cover letter generation with three distinct variants (Conservative, Aggressive, Story-driven) using local Ollama LLM. Generates all variants simultaneously while maintaining data privacy and ensuring content quality validation.
testableOutcomes: System generates conservative cover letter using formal business language between 300-400 words
Conservative variant follows traditional business letter structure with formal salutation and closing
Conservative variant emphasizes professional achievements without bold claims using respectful tone
System generates aggressive cover letter using bold, confident language between 300-400 words
Aggressive variant includes strong action verbs and assertive capability statements
Aggressive variant emphasizes unique value propositions and competitive advantages
System generates story-driven cover letter using narrative storytelling techniques between 300-400 words
Story-driven variant includes specific anecdotes or examples from user experience
Story-driven variant connects personal stories to company mission, values, or culture
System generates exactly 3 distinct variants when cover letter generation is requested
Each variant is clearly labeled as Conservative, Aggressive, or Story-driven
All three variants are returned in structured format for comparison
System returns available variants with error details when any variant fails to generate
System connects to local Ollama API endpoint when cover letter generation is requested
System returns appropriate error message when Ollama service is unavailable
No user data is transmitted to external services during cover letter generation
System validates Ollama response format and content quality
System implements retry logic with exponential backoff for Ollama timeout or errors
System verifies word count is between 300-400 words for each variant
System checks for proper grammar and sentence structure in generated content
System ensures content relevance to the job posting
System verifies each variant maintains distinct style characteristics
System triggers regeneration with improved prompts when content fails validation

deliverables: Cover letter generation service with three variant templates
Prompt engineering system for each cover letter style
Content quality validation and grammar checking service
Parallel generation orchestrator for all three variants
Cover letter comparison and selection UI components
Generation progress tracking and error handling system

buildSequence.implementationNotes: High risk due to complex prompt engineering for three distinct styles and quality validation requirements. Requires sophisticated content analysis to ensure style consistency and professional quality across all variants.

buildSequence.title: Cover Letter Polishing with Claude
buildSequence.summary: Implements AI-powered cover letter polishing using Claude API with automatic polishing for high-match jobs and manual polishing on demand. Provides quality improvements for grammar, clarity, and tone while maintaining user control over the feature.
testableOutcomes: System automatically sends cover letter to Claude API for polishing when job match score is 85% or higher
System does not automatically polish cover letters when job match score is below 85%
User can click 'Polish Cover Letter' button to manually request polishing for any job application
System displays both original and polished versions side-by-side for user comparison after manual polish request
User can select 'Use Polished Version' to replace original with polished content
User can configure automatic polishing threshold between 80% and 95% in user settings
System shows 'Polishing cover letter...' loading indicator during polishing operations
System shows 'Cover letter polished' success message when polishing completes successfully
System preserves original cover letter and logs error when Claude API is unavailable
Polished cover letters have corrected grammar and punctuation compared to originals
Polished cover letters maintain appropriate length without becoming significantly longer or shorter

deliverables: Claude API integration service with polishing prompts
Automatic polishing trigger based on match scores
Manual polish request API endpoints
Polish configuration management service
Cover letter comparison UI components
Polish status tracking and error handling
User settings for polish configuration
Loading and success indicators for polish operations

buildSequence.implementationNotes: Requires careful prompt engineering for consistent polishing quality. Must handle Claude API rate limits and failures gracefully. Polish comparison UI needs responsive design for side-by-side viewing.

buildSequence.title: CV Tailoring System
buildSequence.summary: Implements AI-powered CV tailoring that reorders bullet points by job relevance, adds Key Skills Match sections, and highlights matching technologies. Creates job-specific CV versions while preserving original formatting and providing detailed modification metadata.
testableOutcomes: System reorders CV bullet points with highest relevance score first within each role section
System preserves original bullet point order when relevance scores are equal
System assigns higher relevance scores to bullet points containing job posting keywords
System adds 'Key Skills Match' section after summary when matching skills exist between CV and job posting
System includes only skills present in both CV and job posting in Key Skills Match section
System orders matching skills by frequency of mention in job posting
System recognizes skill variations like 'JavaScript' vs 'JS' and consolidates under job posting's preferred term
System limits Key Skills Match section to top 10 most relevant skills when more than 10 matches exist
System highlights matching technologies with bold formatting throughout all CV sections
System highlights all variations of same technology consistently (React.js, ReactJS as React)
System performs case-insensitive technology matching while preserving original casing
System avoids false positive matches for partial words (Java not matching JavaScript)
System applies all three modifications (reordered bullets, Key Skills Match, highlighted technologies) in single output
System preserves professional formatting including fonts, spacing, and margins in tailored CV
System provides metadata showing count of modifications made during tailoring process
System creates tailored CV as separate document while preserving original CV

deliverables: Bullet point relevance scoring algorithm
CV section reordering service
Key Skills Match section generator
Technology highlighting engine with variation recognition
Skill frequency analysis service
CV formatting preservation utilities
Tailored CV generation orchestrator
Modification metadata tracking system
CV tailoring API endpoints
Error handling for invalid CV formats and unparseable job postings

buildSequence.implementationNotes: Complex text processing requiring accurate skill/technology recognition and semantic similarity scoring. Must preserve document formatting while making content modifications. Requires robust error handling for various CV formats.

buildSequence.title: AI Usage Tracking & Budget Management
buildSequence.summary: Implements comprehensive AI usage tracking and cost management across Ollama and Claude providers. Provides budget configuration, real-time alerts, automatic provider switching, and detailed analytics to help users monitor and control AI-related expenses.
testableOutcomes: System logs Ollama usage with timestamp, operation type, and token count marked as zero cost
System logs Claude usage with timestamp, operation type, token count, and calculated cost based on current pricing
System returns total Ollama operations, total Claude operations, current month Claude cost, and remaining budget when usage statistics are requested
System records each AI operation separately with accurate provider attribution during multiple operations in a session
System sets default monthly Claude budget to $10 when no budget is explicitly configured
System immediately applies new budget limit for current month calculations when administrator updates monthly budget
System accepts positive decimal budget values and rejects negative or zero values during configuration validation
System resets Claude usage cost counter to zero at start of new calendar month while preserving configured budget limit
System displays warning message when Claude usage reaches 75% of monthly budget
System displays urgent warning when Claude usage reaches 90% of monthly budget
System includes current usage amount, budget limit, remaining budget, and estimated operations remaining in budget warning messages
System shows only one alert per threshold to avoid spam when multiple operations cross budget thresholds quickly
System routes all AI requests to Ollama when current month Claude usage equals or exceeds monthly budget
System displays notification that Claude is temporarily unavailable due to budget limits when budget is exceeded and Ollama-only mode is active
System automatically restores Claude availability for new requests at start of new calendar month when usage counter resets
System returns appropriate error message when both Ollama is unavailable and budget is exceeded
System displays daily breakdown of Ollama vs Claude usage for current month in analytics dashboard
System shows usage trends by operation type in analytics when viewing historical usage data
System displays current month spend, remaining budget, and projected month-end cost based on current usage patterns
System shows all monetary values in USD with 2 decimal places precision in cost information displays

deliverables: AI usage tracking service with provider attribution
Cost calculation engine with current Claude pricing
Budget configuration management API
Monthly usage reset scheduler
Budget threshold monitoring and alerting system
Automatic provider switching logic
Usage analytics dashboard components
Budget status and warning UI components
Historical usage data aggregation service
Cost projection algorithm based on usage patterns

buildSequence.implementationNotes: Requires accurate cost calculation based on current Claude pricing tiers. Must handle month boundaries correctly for usage resets. Analytics dashboard needs efficient data aggregation for historical trends. Provider switching logic must be fail-safe to prevent service disruption.

buildSequence.title: Application Tracking Foundation
buildSequence.summary: Implements core job application tracking with status lifecycle management, automatic initial status assignment, and status transition validation. Provides the foundational database schema and API endpoints for tracking applications through the hiring process from 'Saved' to final outcomes.
testableOutcomes: New job application automatically receives 'Saved' status with creation timestamp when created
User can update application status from 'Saved' to 'Reviewing' and system records timestamp
User can update application status from 'Applied' to 'Interviewing' and system records timestamp
System prevents backward status transitions and displays error message when attempted
System allows status change to 'Rejected' from any current status and records timestamp
Application details page displays complete chronological status history with timestamps
Status transition validation rejects invalid changes with clear error messages
Application list view shows current status for each application

deliverables: Application database schema with status tracking
Status transition validation service
Application CRUD API endpoints
Status history tracking system
Application status management UI components
Status transition validation middleware

buildSequence.implementationNotes: Requires careful design of status enum and transition rules. Status history should be implemented as separate table for audit trail. Consider using state machine pattern for status transitions.

buildSequence.title: Application Notes & Rich Text
buildSequence.summary: Delivers comprehensive note-taking capabilities for job applications with rich text formatting, auto-save functionality, and timestamp tracking. Enables users to capture and organize application context with professional formatting options including lists, headings, and text emphasis.
testableOutcomes: User can enter unlimited text in application notes field and text is persisted
User can apply bold formatting to selected text and formatting appears correctly
User can create bulleted and numbered lists with proper formatting
User can apply heading formatting and text displays with appropriate styling
Notes auto-save after 2 seconds of typing inactivity with save indicator
Auto-save displays error indicator with retry option when save fails
User can edit existing notes and changes are preserved with formatting intact
Notes section displays creation timestamp and last modified timestamp in local timezone
Rich text formatting is preserved when notes are saved and reloaded
Unsaved changes are preserved when navigating away and returning to application

deliverables: Rich text editor component with formatting toolbar
Auto-save service with debouncing and error handling
Notes database schema with timestamp tracking
Notes API endpoints for CRUD operations
Offline note editing with sync capabilities
Note formatting preservation utilities
Save status indicators and error handling UI

buildSequence.implementationNotes: Consider using established rich text editor like Quill.js or TipTap. Auto-save should use debouncing to prevent excessive API calls. Rich text content should be stored as structured JSON or HTML with sanitization.

buildSequence.title: Follow-up Reminder System
buildSequence.summary: Implements automated email reminder system for job application follow-ups with 7-day automatic scheduling, snooze functionality, and intelligent cancellation based on status changes. Provides comprehensive reminder management interface for users to control their follow-up strategy.
testableOutcomes: System automatically schedules email reminder 7 days after application status changes to 'Applied'
Daily reminder job sends exactly one reminder email per application reaching 7-day threshold
User receives email with snooze options for 3, 7, or 14 days when reminder is triggered
System schedules next reminder for selected snooze duration when user chooses snooze option
User can permanently dismiss reminders and no future reminders are scheduled for that application
System automatically cancels pending reminders when application status changes to 'Interviewing' or 'Rejected'
Reminder management page displays all applications with active reminders and next reminder dates
Snoozed reminders show snooze duration and next reminder date in management interface
Email service failures trigger retry mechanism for reminder delivery
Applications with dismissed reminders appear in reminder history section

deliverables: Reminder scheduling service with cron job integration
Email reminder template system
Reminder database schema with snooze and dismissal tracking
Reminder management API endpoints
Email delivery service with retry logic
Reminder management UI components
Status change event handlers for reminder cancellation
Daily reminder processing job

buildSequence.implementationNotes: Requires robust email delivery system with retry logic. Consider using job queue for reminder processing. Email templates should include unsubscribe links. Reminder scheduling must handle timezone differences properly.
